qas.question: How old was Gautama when he sat under the Bodhi Tree?
What kind of tree was the Bodhi Tree?
What did Gautama spend the rest of his life doing after reaching enlightenment?

answers.text: he spent the rest of his life teaching the path of awakening he had discovered

qas.question: How old was the Buddha at the time of his death?
What is the south branch of the tree Gautama sat under called?
What was the tree called he sat under?
What was the tree renamed that Gautama achieved enlightenment under?
At what age did Gautama come to pass?
When he was 35 Gautama sat in meditation under what tree?
What type of tree was the Bodhi Tree?
What town was the Bodhi Tree in?
The south branch of the original fig tree is known as?

context: Gautama was now determined to complete his spiritual quest. At the age of <a0_0>35<a0_0/>, he famously sat in meditation under a <a1_0><a5_0><a9_0>Ficus religiosa<a9_0/><a5_0/><a1_0/> tree now called the <a6_0><a8_0>Bodhi Tree<a8_0/><a6_0/> in the town of <a10_0>Bodh Gaya<a10_0/> and vowed not to rise before achieving enlightenment. After many days, he finally destroyed the fetters of his mind, thereby liberating himself from the cycle of suffering and rebirth, and arose as a fully enlightened being (Skt. samyaksaṃbuddha). Soon thereafter, he attracted a band of followers and instituted a monastic order. Now, as the Buddha, <a2_0>he spent the rest of his life teaching the path of awakening he had discovered<a2_0/>, traveling throughout the northeastern part of the Indian subcontinent, and died at the age of <a3_0><a7_0>80<a7_0/><a3_0/> (483 BCE) in Kushinagar, India. The south branch of the original fig tree available only in Anuradhapura Sri Lanka is known as <a4_0><a11_0>Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi<a11_0/><a4_0/>.
